definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: He pulled out a one-gallon, wide-mouth jar and set it on the table in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 他拿出一个一加仑的广口瓶放在他面前的桌上。

sentences.english: To the hot water, add about one cup of baking soda for each gallon of water.
sentences.chinese: 在热水中加入量为每加仑水一茶杯的小苏打。

sentences.english: Would you bring a one-gallon container?
sentences.chinese: 你会带一个一加仑的器皿吗？

sentences.english: The first of what would turn out to be 10.8 million gal. of oil began to spew forth into the cold waters.
sentences.chinese: 1080万加仑的原油喷涌到冰冷的海水中。

sentences.english: "At over $3 a gallon, it's high no matter what, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，“油价大于每加仑3美元，怎么看都是高的。”

sentences.english: It wins over by its absolutely amazing, very compact aroma of matured black currants.
sentences.chinese: 绝对迷人简洁的成熟红加仑芬芳令它得享盛誉。

sentences.english: Our generators typically use more than 20 gallons of fuel a day.
sentences.chinese: 通常情况下，我们的发电机每天使用20加仑的燃料。

sentences.english: Use the blue 4 gpm heavy volume size.
sentences.chinese: 选那种蓝色的4加仑每分钟的大功率产品。

sentences.english: The average American guzzles nearly a full gallon of soda every week.
sentences.chinese: 美国人平均每周要喝掉1加仑的苏打水。

sentences.english: That's how far a gallon of gas goes.
sentences.chinese: 这是指一加仑汽油可开多远。

sentences.english: Deep fried turkeys are boiled at searingtemperatures in up to five gallons of hot oil.
sentences.chinese: 油炸火鸡是放在多达5加仑的热油中用高温炸出来的。

sentences.english: Flow range up to 100,000 GPD per unit.
sentences.chinese: 每组设备的水流量范围高达100，000加仑。

sentences.english: Wide-mouth mason jar and set it on the table in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 出一个一加仑的广口瓶放在他面前的桌上。

sentences.english: The pail will hold four gallons .
A 10-minute shower uses almost 40 gallons of water.
sentences.chinese: 洗十分种大约用水四十加仑。

definition: bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
mile (unit of length equal to 1.609 km)
foot (unit of length equal to 0.3048 m)
tonne/imperial or US tonne, equal to 2240 pounds or 1.016 metric tons
to top up/to fill to the brim
cube (math.)/abbr. for 立方體|立方体[li4 fang1 ti3]/abbr. for 立方米[li4 fang1 mi3]
potable water (water with low salt content)/fresh water
Danshui or Tanshui town in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
